thread.title: David Moyes reckons Leicester sacking Claudio Ranieri will boost Sunderland’s relegation fight
thread.title_full: David Moyes reckons Leicester sacking Claudio Ranieri will boost Sunderland’s relegation fight

author: whaughton
title: David Moyes reckons Leicester sacking Claudio Ranieri will boost Sunderland’s relegation fight
text:
Comments DAVID MOYES reckons Leicester sacking Claudio Ranieri could boost Sunderland’s own hopes of staying up. 
The relegation-threatened Foxes brutally axed the Italian yesterday just nine months after he oversaw their astonishing title triumph. Reuters David Moyes thinks Ranieri sacking could help his struggling Sunderland side 
And Moyes hopes Leicester’s callous decision to dispense of Ranieri backfires. Leicester City's caretaker manager Craig Shakespeare says he is saddened by the sacking of Claudio Ranieri 
Keep up to date with ALL the Sunderland and Leicester City news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Sunderland are currently bottom of the table but only two points adrift of the 17th-placed Premier League champions. 
Asked if sacking Ranieri will give Leicester a bounce, Moyes said: “I actually hope it works the opposite way for them. PA:Press Association Claudio Ranieri sacked by Premier League champions Leicester City PA:Press Association David Moyes is delighted with a well-earned point PA:Press Association 4 The axing of Ranieri underlines one of the most amazing slumps in Prem history 
“I think they had a really good manager, and sometimes changing manager doesn’t always work. “There is not big proof that it works. “I’m hoping that in a way they become a bit rudderless - they are out there looking for a manager when at this time of the season you want to be stable, keeping things right, picking up the points. Tony Cottee speaks on the shock of Leicester City sacking manager Claudio Ranieri related stories Leicester contact Roberto Mancini, with Italian said to be interested in replacing Claudio Ranieri DILLY DING, DILLY GONE Shock as Leicester SACK Claudio Ranieri nine months after miracle 5,000-1 Premier League triumph Neil Ashton Leicester flops who cost Claudio Ranieri his job deserve to lose their Prem title medals PREVIEW Everton vs Sunderland: What TV channel is it on, What time is kick off and what is the latest team news? TRADITION OVER? Stoke and Sunderland have had the most 3pm kick-offs this season with 16... but who's had the least? “I’m really disappointed for Claudio because he’s a good guy. “He did an incredible job to win the league.” For now, though, Moyes has his own issues to contend with at Sunderland. Leicester City win BBC Sports Personality Team of the Year And he has revealed that midfielder Lee Cattermole could miss the rest of the season after picking up an Achilles injury, having just started running again after hip surgery. Moyes said: “Lee is seeing a specialist in London now, I don’t think it will necessarily be a quick return.”
